title: [Neuroscience] Alzheimerâ€™s treatment linked to slower cognitive decline. A dementia treatment plan including cholinesterase inhibitors leads to a slower rate of cognitive decline over five years. Moreover, in comparison to the control group, cholinesterase inhibitors also lower mortality rates by 27 percent.
